text: Yeah, I was in the boy scouts at the time. And we was doing the 50-yard dash, racing, but we was at the pier, marked off,
keypoint: Boy scouts line up for dash on pier

text: and so we was doing the 50-yard dash. There was about 8 or 9 of us, you know, going down, coming back.
keypoint: Eight or nine boys repeatedly race back

text: And, going down the third time, I caught cramps and I started yelling "Help!", but the fellows didn't believe me, you know. They thought I was just trying to catch up, because I was going on or slowing down.
keypoint: Narrator cramps, calls for help, friends dismiss

text: So all of them kept going. They leave me. And so I started going down.
keypoint: Companions continue; narrator begins to go under

text: Scoutmaster was up there. He was watching me. But he didn't pay me no attention either.
And for no reason at all there was another guy, who had just walked up that minute... He just jumped over and grabbed me.
keypoint: Newcomer suddenly leaps in and saves narrator
